page.title: 01YALDING AND NETTLESTEAD
page.content: The block includes the greater part of the village of Yalding, much of the village of Nettlestead and parts of the villages of Hunton, West Farleigh and Wateringbury. As the major village is Yalding, an active community, most references concern Yalding. The villages lie in the picturesque Medway valley at the place where the river has cut its way through the Lower Greensand ridge. It is primarily an agricultural area, the chief crops being hops, fruit and cereals. There is a demand for a great deal of seasonal casual labour. Oast houses, orchards, hop gardens and rivers are features of the landscape. Yalding is particularly attractive, with a medieval bridge, rivers, canal and lock, and with a wealth of buildings, some dating from medieval times.
